instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead after HDD->SSD, Green light ok.
threads.message:
Hi guys,

A friend tried to upgrade to SSD and he did something that killed this mbp,

I noticed that <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> was missing and that <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> gets really hot. I replaced <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> and it gets hot again. There seems to be no short on that line and diode mode at L7220 measures 0.089.

If I connect the magsafe and after <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> gets hot (10-15 secs) this line gives a zero diode mode reading (magsafe disconnected of course).

Since there is no apparent short injecting voltage would be pointless?? Any ideas?

br,
george

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead after HDD->SSD, Green light ok.
threads.message: The short will be on the LDO outputs pin 3, 8 or 17.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead after HDD->SSD, Green light ok.
threads.message:
hi duke,

already checked that and there are no shorts there.. BUT.. I missed that my friend knocked off <CAPACITOR>C7271</CAPACITOR> :)) - problem solved.

thanks!
george
